Interface com.penthera.virtuososdk.client.autodownload.IPlaylistManager

com.penthera.virtuososdk.client.autodownload

Interface IPlaylistManager

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    VirtuosoPlaylistManager
    public interface IPlaylistManager
    IPlaylistManager is used to manage playlists in the autodownload feature. Each IPlaylist contains a collection of IPlaylistItems. Each item represents a single IAsset that is part of the playlist. The playlist manager is used to manage creation, updates to, and deletion of Playlists.
    Since:
    3.16.6
    • Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      append 
      abstract boolean append(IPlaylist playlist)
      Appends to an existing playlist.
      boolean append(IPlaylist playlist)
      Appends to an existing playlist.
      New items are appended to the existing list, but changes to config are not applied once the playlist has been created. Duplicate playlist items are not allowed and will be ignored.
      Parameters:
      playlist - The updated playlist
      Returns:
      true if the update was successful

      Returns:

      getCursor 
      abstract android.database.Cursor getCursor()
      Queries the Uri, returning a Cursor over the result set.
      android.database.Cursor getCursor()
      Queries the Uri, returning a Cursor over the result set.
      The Cursor will default to retrieving all fields and all rows from the Content provider. The sorting order on the Cursor is determined by the internal implementation.
      Returns:
      A Cursor object, which is positioned before the first entry, or null.
      getCursor 
      abstract android.database.Cursor getCursor(java.lang.String[] projection, java.lang.String selection, java.lang.String[] selectionArgs)
      Queries the Uri, returning a Cursor over the result set.
      android.database.Cursor getCursor(java.lang.String[] projection, java.lang.String selection, java.lang.String[] selectionArgs)
      Queries the Uri, returning a Cursor over the result set. The sorting order on the Cursor is determined by the internal implementation.
      Parameters:
      projection - A list of which columns to return. Passing null will return all columns.
      selection - A filter declaring which rows to return, formatted as an SQL WHERE clause (excluding the WHERE itself). Passing null will return all rows.
      selectionArgs - You may include ?s in selection, which will be replaced by the values from selectionArgs, in the order that they appear in the selection. The values will be bound as Strings.
      Returns:
      A Cursor object, which is positioned before the first entry, or null.
      getCursor 
      abstract android.database.Cursor getCursor(java.lang.String[] projection, java.lang.String selection, java.lang.String[] selectionArgs, java.lang.String sort)
      Queries the Uri, returning a Cursor over the result set.
      android.database.Cursor getCursor(java.lang.String[] projection, java.lang.String selection, java.lang.String[] selectionArgs, java.lang.String sort)
      Queries the Uri, returning a Cursor over the result set.
      Parameters:
      projection - A list of which columns to return. Passing null will return all columns.
      selection - A filter declaring which rows to return, formatted as an SQL WHERE clause (excluding the WHERE itself). Passing null will return all rows.
      selectionArgs - You may include ?s in selection, which will be replaced by the values from selectionArgs, in the order that they appear in the selection. The values will be bound as Strings.
      sort - How to order the rows, formatted as an SQL ORDER BY clause (excluding the ORDER BY itself). Passing null will use the default sort order, which may be unordered.
      Returns:
      A Cursor object, which is positioned before the first entry, or null.
